name: 1,3-PROPANEDIAMINE
label: Metabolite
description: An alkane-alpha,omega-diamine comprising a propane skeleton with amino substituents at positions 1 and 3.

name: 2-Ketobutyric acid
label: Metabolite
description: A 2-oxo monocarboxylic acid anion that is the conjugate base of 2-oxobutanoic acid, obtained by deprotonation of the carboxy group.
synonyms: 2-Ketobutanoic acid|2-Oxobutanoic acid|2-oxobutanoate|alpha-Ketobutyric acid|alpha-oxobutyrate|2-KETOBUTYRIC ACID|2-Oxobutanoate|2-Oxobutyrate|2-Ketobutanoate|2-ketobutyrate|2-Oxo-Butyric Acid|2-Oxobutyric acid|2-Ketobutyric acid|3-methyl pyruvic acid|alpha-Ketobutyrate|alpha-oxo-n-butyric acid|alpha-ketobutyrate|alpha-ketobutyric acid

name: 2-HYDROXYBUTYRIC ACID
label: Metabolite
description: A hydroxybutyric acid having a single hydroxyl group located at position 2; urinary secretion of 2-hydroxybutyric acid is increased with alcohol ingestion or vigorous physical exercise and is associated with lactic acidosis and ketoacidosis in humans and diabetes in animals.
synonyms: alpha-hydroxybutyric acid|alpha-hydroxybutanoic acid|2-Hydroxybutanoic acid|2-Hydroxybutyric Acid|2-Hydroxy-Butyric Acid Anion|2-Hydroxybutyric acid

name: 2-METHOXYESTRONE
label: Metabolite
description: A 17-oxo steroid that is estrone in which the hydrogen at position 2 has been replaced by a methoxy group.

name: 3-HYDROXYBUTANOIC ACID, (R)-
label: Metabolite
description: The R-enantiomer of 3-hydroxybutyric acid. Involved in the synthesis and degradation of ketone bodies, it can be used as an energy source by the brain during hypoglycaemia, and for the synthesis of biodegradable plastics. It is a sex pheremone in the European spider Linyphia triangularis.

name: DEOXYURIDINE
label: Metabolite
description: A pyrimidine 2'-deoxyribonucleoside having uracil as the nucleobase.

name: DEOXYCYTIDINE
label: Metabolite
description: A pyrimidine 2'-deoxyribonucleoside having cytosine as the nucleobase.

name: Cortexolone
label: Metabolite
description: A 21-hydroxy steroid that has formula C21H30O4.
